Rules and Regulations: The event wil have 2 rounds. Round 1: 10 Diseases will be shown through projector in pictorial form. Each team will consist of two people. All questions are compulsory. Round 2: Teams who qualify the first round will get to enact the diseases they are told. (In a dumb charades format).

Description: It can't get any higher resolution than this. Join us in The Critter Hunt, where you look out to search for the most unique specimen to examine under a microscope.
Rules and Regulations: Find and mount interesting micro/macroscopic invertebrates and get points based on your ability to grab creepy crawlies

Description: An event aimed towards school students from underprivileged backgrounds, that encourages them to create science models and present them as exhibition.

Ever felt like breaking from the binding pull of gravity? This is your chance... All you need is creativity and a bit of H2O. Thrust is Inquivesta's very own rocket assembly line, where participants get to make their own water-powered rockets, and compete against each other to craft the ultimate flying machine.
Rules and Regulations:
For Newbies:
Attend a fun workshop on Building Water Rockets with us on Saturday (2pm) and we will teach you how to build your very own flying spectacle. Finished Rockets will be launched in the evening, competing against eachother to see who goes the farthest.

For the Experienced:
Get your own Water Rocket to showcase in the competition. Rockets will be judged on how much range they can cover. There will be a special prize for the most elegant design. You can either bring your own launcher or use the one we provide to you.
Prizes: CASH PRIZES.                (based on number of registrations)

Description: Have you ever thought what would happen if you drop an egg from the first floor of your house? Well duh, it would obviuosly break. But wait a minute, what if you needed to save it... So, get ready to lock horns with gravity as you try to protect your precious eggs against the much-feared drop in Beat the Drop
Rules and Regulations: 1. Participants will form a team of 3.
Contact Details: SOUGATA MONDAL: sm22ms013@iiserkol.ac.in 9002161586                NIRAVRA NAG:  nn22ms072@iiserkol.ac.in 8697345673

Description: Get ready to put your creativity to test as you are challenged to do even the simplest of the tasks with ingenious mechanisms constructed out of scrap. So get ready to do some "jugaad" and take part in The NutJob.

One of Inquivesta's trademark scientific debate competiition. Science and Technology are all about the truth, as well as the rightfull application of the truth for some benefit. However in today's complicated world, various concepts and opinions exist about ethics itsels. Join the ultimate Debate and establish your truth! Of course, rationale-y!
Unleash your inner scientist and showcase your genius at Fauxpert - where creativity meets knowledge!
Prizes: Online Round : Rs 500   Offline Round : 1st prize-Rs 1000 2nd prize-Rs 500

Description: No matter what, Inquivesta would be incomplete without one of its legacy events, Crime Scene Investigation. Get ready to put on your thinking caps and crack codes, work with clues, investigate the crime scene, interrogate people and deduce who the real culprit is within the span of two days.
Contact Details: Mandar Tijare ( tmr21ms016@iiserkol.ac.in ) ( 9920827228 ) Deepak Kudari ( dak21ms202@iiserkol.ac.in ) ( 9148001921 ) Shreeyash Chaudhari ( sc21ms182@iiserkol.ac.in )( 9137971093 )

Description: It is a known fact that humans like to be tested and to compete against each other to assert dominance over the opposition. It has historically been proven that it is the Brain and Brawn who comes out on top. Quizzing provides a brilliant activity to keep the same spirit of competition with your opponents using your brainpower by forcing one to think outside the box to work on trivia-based questions, with the hints or relations that are to be searched for in the questions. With this same objective in mind, we bring you GNQ, The Quizzing event of INQUIVESTA X!
Prizes: Prizes worth Rs.4,000 to be won
Registration fee: Rs.150 per team for online and Rs.200 per team for spot registrations
Registration Deadline: Online registrations deadline is 31 March 2023. Spot registrations will be open though

Description: From Ascent to Haven, Fracture to Pearl, We present to you the mega valorant tournament for all those gamers. A tournament with exciting prizes and lots of enjoyment with your felllow teammates and opponents.
Location: Seminfinals and Final will be done in G02

Description: Do mind it that scientists with their endless curiosity can say "omae wa mau shinderu" to their research for a day and binge watch anime. So, why not show their love for characters of their favourite anime through cosplay?How about with the POWER OF FRIENDSHIP, they bring some unknown people from totally different tep into the world of anime and unleash your inner hero at Anicon - where imagination meets reality! Cosplay your heart out and join the ultimate celebration of all things animeprofessions and backgrounds, to an event where they all are bonded through a common link!!! For that only, INQUIVESTA-X brings you anicon 2.0!!!
Registration fee: rs69 early bird.  rs 100 audience with free manga panel.    rs 169 audience with free poster and games

Description: An exciting dance competition where individuals/duos/groups have to showcase pre-rehearsed performances to get exciting prizes!
Rules and Regulations: The dance performance should have a time limit of 2 minutes, not more than that. There are no restricitons on the dance style. Register for the event through google form.
Prizes: 1st prize - Rs 3000 and many other exciting prizes and merch for other winners

Description: Just a fun event starting at mid night for relaxation, jokes and gossips.
Rules and Regulations: Event starts at midnight, Have fun, start performing in front of an open mic. Just don't be Political, immoral or immaturely vulgar. Don't target anyone and disturb the integrity of the event.
Location: LHC tree space or near water tank(rain)

Description: For the growing number of K-Pop fans in India; Play the games that your favorite celebrities (idols) play!
Rules and Regulations: Daebak Trivia Quiz (12:00 - 13:00): Compete with other fans in the given 30 seconds and answer as many questions as you can. Three rounds: Round 1 is a qualifier round, from where 10 of the players will advance to Round 2 and finally 5 of those will advance to Round 3. 2 out of 5 will win! Shout in silence (14:00 - 15:00): Two players should work as a team, they will desperately try to communicate while listening to loud K-Pop through headphones. Those who manage to communicate atleast 5 of the given messages in 2 minutes will win!        K-Bop or K-Flop (16:00 - 17:00): The game involves the player suggesting a K-pop song to non-K-Pop fans who will act as judges and rate the song that was suggested to them. Those suggesting songs that garner highest ratings from the judges are entitled to amazing prizes!
Registration Deadline: Till the day of the event

Description: Musical event where a single performer can perform with a karaoke or backing instrument.
Rules and Regulations:
Participants have to register at the registration desk in the event itself in order to participate.
Entry fee is 50/-
Participants are requested to keep their karaoke tracks ready and should be able to email or whatsapp to a given contact as soon as possible.
The time limit for each performance is 3 minutes. All genres of music are allowed.
Participants would be performing in a
first come first perform manner.

Competition-
There will be 2 judges of the event whose combined marks would be considered for the final result.
The Judges decision is final.. 
As this is an informal fest event,
participants are expected to not create an issue following the judgements. 
The winner and runners up will get special gifts.
Participants would be judged on the basis of rhythm, tune, diction and presentation.
Any participant disturbing the integrity of the show would be disqualified. 
Only solo performances are allowed.Participants can use backing instruments too.
Registration: To be done on the spot.
